meanings.definition: The act of extinguishing or putting out a fire or light.
meanings.sent1: The firefighter's quick extinguishment of the flames saved the building.
meanings.sent2: The extinguishment of the candle left the room in darkness.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved the sudden extinguishment of all the candles in the room.
meanings.sent4: The extinguishment of hope felt like a sudden gust of wind blowing out a candle.
meanings.sent5: The extinguishment of the bonfire was so swift, it seemed like magic.

meanings.definition: The state of being extinguished or put out.
meanings.sent1: The darkness in the room indicated the extinguishment of the candle.
meanings.sent2: The extinguishment of the fire left only embers glowing in the dark.
meanings.sent3: The extinguishment of the streetlights made the night seem mysterious and eerie.
meanings.sent4: The extinguishment of the stars at dawn heralded the arrival of morning.
meanings.sent5: The sudden extinguishment of the lantern cast shadows on the walls.

meanings.definition: The act of bringing something to an end or making it disappear.
meanings.sent1: The extinguishment of the argument brought peace to the room.
meanings.sent2: The extinguishment of the old traditions marked the beginning of a new era.
meanings.sent3: The extinguishment of the rumor spread quickly through the town.
meanings.sent4: The extinguishment of the last light signaled the end of the performance.
meanings.sent5: The extinguishment of the old ways paved the path for progress.
